name: Addax
description: The Addax has a pale coat adapted to desert environments, living in arid landscapes with little water.
spread_note: Originally throughout the Sahara, now only a small area in Niger
proportions: Body length 1.2–1.8 m; tail length 25–35 cm; shoulder height 1–1.1 m; weight 60–125 kg
reproduction: Gestation lasts 257–264 days, usually one calf is born.
attractions: Highly adapted to arid conditions, addaxes can survive on the moisture in their food. They are nocturnal, traveling at night to find food.
projects_note: Once widespread across the Sahara, their numbers have dwindled drastically. Conservation efforts include reintroduction from zoo populations, including those bred at Prague Zoo.
breeding: Prague Zoo has kept addaxes since 1979.
